perturbation.original_text: 1. Definitions: 1.1 "Product" or "Products" mean those nanomaterials, coated nanomaterials and dispersions of nanomaterials listed in Schedule A, as amended from time to time by mutual written agreement signed by the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Definitions: 1.1 "Goods" or "Products" mean those nanomaterials, coated nanomaterials and dispersions of nanomaterials listed in Schedule A, as amended from time to time by mutual written agreement signed by the parties.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Product' with 'Goods', but later sections still refer to 'Product', creating ambiguity about whether 'Goods' and 'Products' are interchangeable throughout the contract. 'Goods' is not consistently used, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Subject to Section 2.2, NTC shall use all reasonable commercial efforts to fill orders placed by ALFA AESAR with all reasonable promptness provided, however, that NTC shall have no obligation to furnish any Products hereunder which have been discontinued. In the event any order is not filled within thirty (30) days of receipt by NTC, ALFA AESAR has the right, but not the obligation, to seek alternative sourcing from a third- party without liability to NTC.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Subject to Section 2.2, NTC shall use all reasonable commercial efforts to fill orders placed by ALFA AESAR with all reasonable promptness provided, however, that NTC shall have no obligation to furnish any items hereunder which have been discontinued. In the event any order is not filled within thirty (30) days of receipt by NTC, ALFA AESAR has the right, but not the obligation, to seek alternative sourcing from a third- party without liability to NTC.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Products' with 'items'. The contract relies on the term 'Products' throughout. Changing it here introduces uncertainty about whether 'items' refers specifically to the defined 'Products' or something broader. It is not clear whether 'items' and 'Products' are meant to be identical. This affects NTC's obligation to supply.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Return Rights. Subject to the protocol described below, ALFA AESAR shall have the right to return at NTC's expense, and for full credit of ALFA AESAR's cost, any Products (i.) for which a legitimate and credible allegation is made that the use of such Products infringes on any patent, trademark, trade secret, copyright, right of privacy or publicity, or any other tangible or intangible proprietary or intellectual property right; (b) that are not manufactured, packaged, or labeled in accordance with specifications or industry standards; (c) that are shipped in error or in non-conformance with ALFA AESAR's purchase order; or (d) that are damaged or defective.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Return Rights. Subject to the protocol described below, ALFA AESAR shall have the right to return at NTC's expense, and for full credit of ALFA AESAR's cost, any materials (i.) for which a legitimate and credible allegation is made that the use of such Products infringes on any patent, trademark, trade secret, copyright, right of privacy or publicity, or any other tangible or intangible proprietary or intellectual property right; (b) that are not manufactured, packaged, or labeled in accordance with specifications or industry standards; (c) that are shipped in error or in non-conformance with ALFA AESAR's purchase order; or (d) that are damaged or defective.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Products' with 'materials'. The section concerns return rights. By using 'materials' it's unclear if this includes only the defined 'Products' or other ancillary goods or packaging. The rest of the sentence continues to use 'Products', creating further ambiguity. This affects ALFA AESAR's ability to return items and receive credit.
